doc: Homeassistant seems to work after 0.46 upgrade, but zwave times out
HASS.io latest version, host 0.8, supervisor 0.36,  on Raspberry Pi 3

Everything in Home assistant seems to work as before the upgrade from 0.45 to 0.46, but the 2 zwave switches I currently use don't respond anymore and seem to time out. Have rebooted a few times, but error is consistent.
2017-06-07 18:11:44 ERROR (MainThread) [homeassistant.core] Error doing job: Task exception was never retrieved
2017-06-07 18:39:01 ERROR (MainThread) [homeassistant.core] Timer got out of sync. Resetting
and these a few lines from OZW.log:
2017-06-07 18:37:20.771 Info, Node003, Value::Set - COMMAND_CLASS_SWITCH_BINARY - Switch - 0 - 1 - True
2017-06-07 18:37:20.772 Info, Node003, SwitchBinary::Set - Setting node 3 to On

2017-06-07 18:37:20.772 Info, Node003, Sending (Send) message (Callback ID=0x27, Expected Reply=0x13) - SwitchBinaryCmd_Set (Node=3): 0x01, 0x0a, 0x00, 0x13, 0x03, 0x03, 0x25, 0x01, 0xff, 0x25, 0x27, 0x3f
2017-06-07 18:37:21.773 Error, Node003, ERROR: Dropping command, expected response not received after 1 attempt(s)
